alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; San Saba; Shackelford; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 30 at 8:04PM CDT until July 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT MONDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 105 expected. * WHERE...Throckmorton, Shackelford, Callahan, Brown and San Saba Counties. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from noon to 8 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Callahan; San Saba; Shackelford; Throckmorton
